comment: The course covers a lot of content with many assignments to complete. The exams are open-note and the ppts help a ton. Definitely go through the practice exams to prepare. There is a group project, and it is very time intensive, so find a good group and knock that out early. All in all, not amazing, but not bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: This professor is a VERY harsh grader regarding discussion posts. His HW is automatically graded (decimal points are issues)and each HW assignment takes about 2 hours. Smartbook questions have about 75 questions each, and quizzes do not reflect material in the textbook or slides. Now add this weekly and this about sums up this professor and course.
Simply the worst teacher Ive had at my time at ksu. If you have ANY other option, choose another professor over him. You'll thank me later

This professor has to be one of the most difficult I've taken in college so far. He makes you do a group project and the requirement is to tour a manufacturing facility (I am in an online class). This made things very difficult as I chose online classes for a reason. Hard exams and smart books every week.

comment: Way too much unnecessary work. He asks the same question 10 times.

comment: Overall, I did not like this class. The professor was very hard to read. He almost seemed annoyed when people asked questions. His attendance policy was weird, and if you did not attend certain classes, you could miss an assignment that was for a grade. Also, a lot of assignments through connect. Exams are hard. Would not take this professor again.

-12/10 professor. Weekly assignments manageable, grades attendance heavily. Exams are impossible even with notes (like A-K "check all that apply" type Q's). Practice exams have 200+ Q's!  Grades harshly and leaves no wiggle room for students. Very strict and lectures drag. Acts annoyed and almost pretentious when I would ask Q's. Take someone else!

This man can talk forever, took him for a 3hr summer class and he went the whole time. LOTS of connect HW, quizzes and smartbooks. Two separate tests for each section (problems & concepts). Uses lockdown but is open book/open notes. Very large group project due at end of semester (includes a mandatory tour of a manufacturing plant of your choosing)

Cons: Large workload with many hours/week spent on homework, and scheduling a tour of a plant for the group project was a pain with inflexible group members.

Pros: Lots of graded activities that you can attempt multiple times, so many opportunities to boost your grade. Prof was also accessible through email and was always willing to lend a hand.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: He's just not that great of a professor. Take this class with someone else.
He wasn't bad the workload was expected but the exams are a little tough. kind of a butt, but I think it's nice that he has videos.

Excellent professor! There is a lot of work involved in this course, so he gives you extra credit opportunities. He has also created a YouTube channel to help you with the math portion of the class to use as a reference. He uses Connect for homework, smart books and quizzes. There are three exams and one group project. No final exam. Hard to fail.

The course is well set up for online and gives you all the material you need to pass. The videos are pre-recorded but are very thorough. For an online class, it was not bad. There is 1 group project paper of 4,000 words but there are 4 group members so it isn't so bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Worst teacher that I have ever taken at KSU. He grades extremely harshly and his discussion responses are beyond too much work. Discussion initial post due Tuesday and responses due by Sunday of each week. I would do about 12-15 discussion replies to make an A on them. Many other bad things but I'll end it here. DO NOT TAKE!

I still do not understand why Professor Richardson has such a low rating. Yes, there is a ton of work in this class but it is a 4000 level class, get over it. The content is not necessarily difficult and he gives you feedback on what needs to be done to get a better grade. He is a professional and expects you to act like one too.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof. Richardson is a much better professor than his rating implies. He is clearly an expert in his field and treats you as a professional. The content is difficult but he gives you all the tools you need to succeed. The class is based on Connect, exams, and a group project. The people that struggle in this class expect their hands to be held.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: Dr. Richardson is an expert in the field of operations management, and you can see that in how he conducts the class. He provides you all the materials you need to do well. Class is 40% connect, 40% exams (3) and 20% group project (research paper). He also gives extra credit opportunities. The cowboy hat in the staff photo says it all: legend!!!

Ronny Richardson's Operations Management class was difficult, but the grading system was also extremely forgiving. 40% of your grade is from the textbook activities which can be done unlimited times so they are a free 100. He also gives 10 points to your test average for the course eval. Finally, he adjusts project grades based off the peer evals.

Dr. Richardson was easily one of the most engaging professors I've ever had. He frequently reaches out to offer individualized feedback and provides many supplemental resources to empower success in an online course. He also allows unlimited attempts on weekly assignments and provides practice exams. Not the easiest course, but he is a great guy.

he wants to fail you. he grades INSANELY hard. for discussions for example you have to post by Tuesday of the week and if you don't it's half off and then if you don't respond to other peoples discussion posts you get an F. He overtrades everything and puts too much emphasis on homework grades.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Took him for Operations Mgmt and this class is HARD. Im giving him 5 stars because despite how hard he makes the class, hes an outstanding professor.

HE SUCKS! Took his class ONLINE. 90 question test with calculations on every problem and 2 hours to take it. Impossible. He is the king of busy work. If you work at all you won't have time. I can't believe I paid for this

comment: In an online setting he assigns lots of busy work. I have more work in this one class than my other 4 combined..

Very nice guy but he reads directly from powerpoint. If you go over the powerpoint before the tests, you're good to go. No class the week of a test & they're online. Easy HW after each chapter. comment: By far the worst online teacher I have ever had. Unorganized, clueless, and not clear in any of his directions. Worst class business majors have to take. Everyone was astonished I made a 75 on the math portion of the test since most people made less than 50. He does not curve the test despite the low grades. This class is difficult but Dr. Richardson gives you everything you need in order to pass the class. HW is in connect along with quizzes and learn smart assignments. He allows multiple submissions of the HW and takes your highest grade. Everyone should be able to get 100 on all the HW, learnsmart, and online quizzes.

NOT the professor to take online. The exams are split into two sections: concepts and problems. Concepts are extremely similar to the powerpoints and an easy A, but the problem portions are nearly impossible.

This was the worst experiences I've had in a class. He constantly sent automated emails & would bug you if you didn't have an assignment or test completed three days before the due date. Pretty sure the whole class failed the problems portion of the last exam (split into concepts & math) b/c the practice exam didn't prepare us at all. Don't take.

comment: The class is hard, but Dr. Richardson gives you ALL the tools you need to succeed. Take advantage of this! He is very involved! There is no reason for you to fail this class if you do what you are supposed to do! There is one group project, connect hw and quizzes, and 3 tests (each test has a concept part, and a problem part).

Best online professor I have ever had. Exams were split between concepts and math, math sections were almost incomprehensible at first glance. Richardson gave us innumerable resources to succeed. Podcast lectures to go along with power point notes, Udemy videos, practice exams. He was the most involved online professor I have ever had.

Very difficult class, mostly because of how unnecessarily hard the tests were and how inconvenient the group project was. He basically lets Connect do all the teaching for him. Lectures were very boring and overly technical, and he is not much help outside of class (or in it). Would not recommend.

Don't take a class with this professor. You won't pass. His exams don't reflect anything taught. Expect to make 30's on the exams even after studying for hours. By far the worst class I have ever had to take.

THE EXAMS WEIGH 40% OF YOUR GRADE. HE DOES NOT HAVE ANY LECTURE OR LECTURE NOTES. EVERYTHING IS DONE IN CONNECT. THE EXAMS ARE 3 HRS (1HR FOR CONCEPTS & 2 HOURS FOR PROBLEMS)! THE HOMEWORK AND QUIZ EXAMPLES DOES NOT HELP WITH EXAM AT ALL! YOUR TEACHING YOURSELF

comment: DO NOT TAKE HIM online or in clsss! I had operations MGT online with him. He does not give feedback on exams. Homework is extremely difficult. This is the worse professor I've had at KSU.

This class was pretty lame. Lectures dragged on with little real world application. Constant tangents about being in the army. We're a few classes I was pretty offended by the racist jokes.
